author: Mohamed Oumoumad
description: Convert any image to jpeg, requires imagemagick, can be downloaded here : http://imagemagick.org/script/download.php make sure to enable legacy commands like (convert etc) while installing.

params.name: magick executer
params.tooltip: the path to your magick executable, if you already have it in your PATH environement variable, then just put 'magick', if left empty the one in libs/ will be used

params.name: Background color
params.tooltip: format types : name (ex : 'white'), hex (ex : '#ddddff'), or rgb int (ex : 'rgb(255,255,255)')

params.name: Quality
params.tooltip: 1 (lowest image quality and highest compression) to 100 (best quality but least effective compression).

params.name: Tiles
params.tooltip: choose how much tiles you want horizontally and vertically. with this format columnsXrows (ex : '3x2' means it'll put 3 culumns and 2 rows), if left empty, imagemagick will try to make the best guess for the number of images given, you can also specify just column or just rows, (ex : x3 or 2x)

params.name: margin
params.tooltip: spacing between each image, + for positive and - for negative space (ex : -5-5 means images will overlap each other with 5px horizontally and vertically)

params.name: Max size
params.tooltip: (widthxheight ex: 1280x720) Specify a maximum box size, the images will shrink to fit the box if they are bigger, but won't change if they are smaller

params.name: Display image name
params.tooltip: when checked each image will have a label with the image name

params.name: Display image resolution
params.tooltip: when checked each image will have a label with the image size

params.name: Text color
params.tooltip: color of the image text label and title. format types : name (ex : 'grey'), hex (ex : '#ddddff'), or rgb int (ex : 'rgb(255,255,255)')

params.name: Text size
params.tooltip: size of the text label in pixels

params.name: Pack title
params.tooltip: You can have a title appear on top of the images pack

params.name: Output name
params.tooltip: input the file name, if left empty the source name will be used

params.name: Output directory
params.tooltip: you can specify another directory, if left empty the file will be at the same directory as the source
